H0.text: Egg is the stage of a butterfly’s life cycle during which it is most similar to a baby bird that must eat a lot of food to grow.

H1.text: Larva is the stage of a butterfly’s life cycle that is most similar to a baby bird, because a baby bird must eat a lot of food to grow.

H2.text: Pupa is the stage of a butterfly's life cycle most similar to a baby bird, which must eat a lot of food to grow.

H3.text: Adult is the stage of a butterfly’s life cycle that is most similar to a baby bird, because a baby bird must eat a lot of food to grow.

A4.text: Caterpillars have been called 'eating machines', and eat leaves voraciously.

A5.text: Caterpillars grow very quickly; for instance, a tobacco hornworm will increase its weight ten-thousandfold in less than twenty days.
